title: West Indies Super50 Cup 2024, all you need to know: Schedule, squads and where to watch live
description: The Super50 Cup, Cricket West Indies' domestic List A competition began on October 29. Here is all you need to know about the competition including the schedule, squads and where to watch live.
author: Rahul Iyer
excerpt: The Super50 Cup, Cricket West Indies' domestic List A competition began on October 29. Here is all you need to know about the competition including the schedule, squads and where to watch live.
text: Nov 03, 2024 0 minute read News The Super50 Cup, Cricket West Indies' domestic List A competition began on October 29. Here is all you need to know about the competition including the schedule, squads and where to watch live. The Super50 competition has been conducted in various forms since 1972-73. There have been 25 different teams to take part in the tournament through the years, including teams from Ireland, Canada and the USA. Trinidad & Tobago are the defending champions of the tournament, having lifted the trophy in 2023-24, led by Darren Bravo (416 runs) and Sunil Narine (20 wickets). T&T have also won the competition the most number of times, with the 2023-24 title being their 13th. This year, the eight participating teams are Leeward Islands Hurricanes, Barbados Pride, Trinidad and Tobago Red Force, Windward Islands Volcanoes, Guyana Harpy Eagles, Combined Campuses and Colleges, Jamaica Scorpions and West Indies Academy. Full squads Windward Island Volcanoes: Alick Athanaze, Desron Maloney, Jeremy Solozano, Sunil Ambris (c), Johnnel Eugene, Kavem Hodge, Shadrack Descarte, Shamar Springer, Dillon Douglas (Wk), Stephan Pascal (Wk), Darel Cyrus, Darius Martin, Gilon Tyson, Kenneth Dember, Ryan John. Guyana Harpy Eagles: Kanhaiya Ramkarran, Kevlon Anderson, Matthew Nandu, Rampertab Ramnauth, Sachin Singh, Tagenarine Chanderpaul, Anthony Adams, Devon Lord, Keemo Paul, Kevin Sinclair, Ronaldo Ali Mohamed, Kemol Savory (Wk), Tevin Imlach (c & Wk), Ashmead Nedd, Isai Thorne, Junior Sinclair, Nial Smith, Richie Looknauth, Sylus Tyndall, Veerasammy Permaul. Leeward Islands Hurricanes: Chesney Hughes, Justin Greaves, Karima Gore, Keacy Carty, Mikyle Louis, Tyrone Williams, Cameron Pennyfeather, Colin Archibald, Dimitri Adams, Jeremiah Louis, Kadeem Henry, Kofi James, Rahkeem Cornwall (c), Jahmar Hamilton (Wk), Jaleel Clarke (Wk), Jewel Andrew (Wk), Akadianto Willett, Daniel Doram, Hayden Walsh, Javier Spencer, Oshane Thomas. Jamaica Scorpions: Carlos Brown, Jermaine Blackwood, John Campbell, Kirk Mckenzie, Odain McCatty, Brad Barnes, Javelle Glen, Odean Smith, Tamarie Redwood, Daniel Beckford (Wk), Jordan Johnson (Wk), Romaine Morrison (Wk), Gordon Bryan, Govasta Edmond, Jeavor Royal, Marquino Mindley, Ojay Shields, Pete Salmon. Barbados Pride: Kadeem Alleyne, Kevin Wickham, Matthew Jones, Zachary McCaskie, Dominic Drakes, Kyle Mayers (c), Nyeem Young, Raymon Reifer, Demetrius Richards (Wk), Leniko Boucher (Wk), Chemar Holder, Javed Leacock, Jomel Warrican, Kemar Smith. West Indies Academy: Ackeem Auguste, Justin Jagessar, Nimar Bolden, Teddy Bishop, Andrew Rambaran, Jediah Blades, Joshua Bishop, Micheal Palmer, Zishan Motara, Carlon Bowen-Tuckett (Wk), Rivaldo Clarke (Wk), Johann Layne, Kelvin Pitman, McKenny Clarke, Raneico Smith. Trinidad & Tobago Red Force: Isaiah Rajah, Jyd Goolie, Kjorn Ottley, Tion Webster, Jason Mohammed, Khary Pierre, Mark Deyal, Yannic Cariah, Amir Jangoo (Wk), Joshua Da Silva (c & Wk), Anderson Phillip, Bryan Charles, Joshua James, Terrance Hinds. Combined Campuses & Colleges: Johann Jeremiah, Jonathan Drakes, Kamil Pooran, Kieran Powell, Shamarh Brooks (c), Shaqkere Parris, Abhijai Mansingh, Akshaya Persaud, Romario Greaves, Demario Richards (Wk), Akeem Jordan, Amari Goodridge, Khari Campbell, Mikkel Govia. West Indies Super50 Cup: Where to watch live Where to watch in the Caribbean Fans in the Caribbean can catch the Super50 on the ESPN Caribbean channel. Where to watch in India The matches can be live-streamed in India through the Fancode app or website. Where to watch in the rest of the world For territories without a broadcast deal, the matches can be streamed on Cricket West Indies' YouTube channel. html:
Nov 03, 2024 0 minute read News

The Super50 Cup, Cricket West Indies' domestic List A competition began on October 29. Here is all you need to know about the competition including the schedule, squads and where to watch live.

The Super50 competition has been conducted in various forms since 1972-73. There have been 25 different teams to take part in the tournament through the years, including teams from Ireland, Canada and the USA.

Trinidad & Tobago are the defending champions of the tournament, having lifted the trophy in 2023-24, led by Darren Bravo (416 runs) and Sunil Narine (20 wickets). T&T have also won the competition the most number of times, with the 2023-24 title being their 13th.

This year, the eight participating teams are Leeward Islands Hurricanes, Barbados Pride, Trinidad and Tobago Red Force, Windward Islands Volcanoes, Guyana Harpy Eagles, Combined Campuses and Colleges, Jamaica Scorpions and West Indies Academy.

West Indies Super50 Cup: Full schedule and list of fixtures

Date Fixture
October 29, 2024 Trinidad and Tobago Red Force vs Combined Campuses and Colleges
October 29, 2024 Guyana Harpy Eagles vs Windward Islands Volcanoes

West Indies Super50 Cup: Full squads

Windward Island Volcanoes: Alick Athanaze, Desron Maloney, Jeremy Solozano, Sunil Ambris (c), Johnnel Eugene, Kavem Hodge, Shadrack Descarte, Shamar Springer, Dillon Douglas (Wk), Stephan Pascal (Wk), Darel Cyrus, Darius Martin, Gilon Tyson, Kenneth Dember, Ryan John.

Guyana Harpy Eagles: Kanhaiya Ramkarran, Kevlon Anderson, Matthew Nandu, Rampertab Ramnauth, Sachin Singh, Tagenarine Chanderpaul, Anthony Adams, Devon Lord, Keemo Paul, Kevin Sinclair, Ronaldo Ali Mohamed, Kemol Savory (Wk), Tevin Imlach (c & Wk), Ashmead Nedd, Isai Thorne, Junior Sinclair, Nial Smith, Richie Looknauth, Sylus Tyndall, Veerasammy Permaul.

Leeward Islands Hurricanes: Chesney Hughes, Justin Greaves, Karima Gore, Keacy Carty, Mikyle Louis, Tyrone Williams, Cameron Pennyfeather, Colin Archibald, Dimitri Adams, Jeremiah Louis, Kadeem Henry, Kofi James, Rahkeem Cornwall (c), Jahmar Hamilton (Wk), Jaleel Clarke (Wk), Jewel Andrew (Wk), Akadianto Willett, Daniel Doram, Hayden Walsh, Javier Spencer, Oshane Thomas.

Jamaica Scorpions: Carlos Brown, Jermaine Blackwood, John Campbell, Kirk Mckenzie, Odain McCatty, Brad Barnes, Javelle Glen, Odean Smith, Tamarie Redwood, Daniel Beckford (Wk), Jordan Johnson (Wk), Romaine Morrison (Wk), Gordon Bryan, Govasta Edmond, Jeavor Royal, Marquino Mindley, Ojay Shields, Pete Salmon.

Barbados Pride: Kadeem Alleyne, Kevin Wickham, Matthew Jones, Zachary McCaskie, Dominic Drakes, Kyle Mayers (c), Nyeem Young, Raymon Reifer, Demetrius Richards (Wk), Leniko Boucher (Wk), Chemar Holder, Javed Leacock, Jomel Warrican, Kemar Smith.

West Indies Academy: Ackeem Auguste, Justin Jagessar, Nimar Bolden, Teddy Bishop, Andrew Rambaran, Jediah Blades, Joshua Bishop, Micheal Palmer, Zishan Motara, Carlon Bowen-Tuckett (Wk), Rivaldo Clarke (Wk), Johann Layne, Kelvin Pitman, McKenny Clarke, Raneico Smith.

Trinidad & Tobago Red Force: Isaiah Rajah, Jyd Goolie, Kjorn Ottley, Tion Webster, Jason Mohammed, Khary Pierre, Mark Deyal, Yannic Cariah, Amir Jangoo (Wk), Joshua Da Silva (c & Wk), Anderson Phillip, Bryan Charles, Joshua James, Terrance Hinds.

Combined Campuses & Colleges: Johann Jeremiah, Jonathan Drakes, Kamil Pooran, Kieran Powell, Shamarh Brooks (c), Shaqkere Parris, Abhijai Mansingh, Akshaya Persaud, Romario Greaves, Demario Richards (Wk), Akeem Jordan, Amari Goodridge, Khari Campbell, Mikkel Govia.

West Indies Super50 Cup: Where to watch live

Where to watch in the Caribbean

Fans in the Caribbean can catch the Super50 on the ESPN Caribbean channel.

Where to watch in India

The matches can be live-streamed in India through the Fancode app or website.

Where to watch in the rest of the world

For territories without a broadcast deal, the matches can be streamed on Cricket West Indies' YouTube channel.
